image.altText: A middle-aged woman and man standing outside gold automatic sliding doors

props.synopsis: South Australia's District Court has apologised for an error which incorrectly recorded a guilty finding in the blackmail case against former Labor MP Annabel Digance and her husband.

title.children: Court apologises for error in blackmail case against former MP

image.altText: A photo of two people, leaning on a farm fence and looking at the camera, at their rural home

props.synopsis: Richard and Kimberly Byers went from running their own business and living comfortably to being unable to afford groceries, a story charity Foodbank says is becoming all too common.

title.children: From double incomes to 'drowning in debt', households turn to food charity

image.altText: packets of cigarettes and vapes

props.synopsis: South Australia's illicit tobacco task force is continuing to see "larger volumes of product" seized in regional areas, including more than 1,000 packets of illegal cigarettes and 500 vapes seized across six stores in the Riverland region.

title.children: Larger volumes of illegal tobacco products being seized in regional SA

image.altText: Indigenous Peoples, Aboriginal, Festival

props.synopsis: The Mutawintji Cultural Festival brings First Nations groups together from across the country offering a safe space to exchange dances, songs and culture.

title.children: 'Pure joy' as Mutawintji festival brings mob together in dance

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing sunglasses takes a selfie

props.synopsis: A woman has told a court how she "watched helplessly" as her partner was set on fire and murdered by his housemate in Adelaide's west more than four years ago. Warning: This story contains content which some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Murder victim set alight in 'act of extreme cruelty', partner tells court

image.altText: Adelaide guard Patrick D'Arcy stands below a basketball backboard holding a basketball

props.synopsis: Patrick D'Arcy is a rising star of Australian basketball. The teenager hopes to one day play professionally after signing a four-year deal to play for East Carolina University.

title.children: Adelaide rising star shoots his way into lucrative world of US college basketball

image.altText: a teenage girl with long blonde hair and her mother who had dark brown hair, standing cheek to cheek and smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Polycystic ovary syndrome affects between 6 and 13 per cent of women, but its name has been labelled misleading. An Australian-led initiative is pushing for a global change.

title.children: PCOS sufferers call for 'misleading' name to be changed

image.altText: A man with short grey hair wearing a vest and wetsuit.

props.synopsis: A tourism survey finds about 40 per cent of South Australian businesses impacted by the toxic algal bloom have experienced a downturn in trade as the government's financial support is starting to flow to those affected.

title.children: Algal bloom and 'negative perceptions' affecting SA tourism, survey finds

image.altText: The underside of two wind turbine blades in helix form attached to the top of a pole with wires

props.synopsis: A small-scale wind turbine has been developed in Adelaide in the hope of supplying energy direct to off-grid users, including farms, wineries and construction sites.

title.children: Wind turbine trial sparks hope as small-scale power source

image.altText: an elegant  woman with short, grey hair wearing a green shirt and smart jacket.

props.synopsis: Greens leader Rosalie Woodruff announces the party cannot lend its support to Tasmanian Labor's bid to form minority government "at this stage".

title.children: Tasmanian Greens withhold support 'at this stage' for Labor's bid to form government

image.altText: Erin Patterson looks at the camera as she sits in the back of a prison van

props.synopsis: A Victorian judge says prosecutors were seeking to use "dubious" arguments to convict Erin Patterson of poisoning her husband before the Crown abandoned its case.

title.children: Dropped Erin Patterson poisoning charges were 'dubious', judge says

image.altText: Matt Wright has brown hair and is wearing a button-up shirt as he walks towards the court.

props.synopsis: The helicopter pilot in the crash that killed Netflix star Chris "Willow" Wilson says Matt Wright's employees idolised him and would follow his directions to disconnect chopper flight recorders. Follow the trial live.

title.children: Pilot in fatal chopper crash says workers did 'whatever' Matt Wright said

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Pilot 'a different person' after helicopter accident
'If he said jump, they said how high'

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at the White House while holding a paper showing a graph.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says his administration is seizing control of the Washington DC police department and deploying the National Guard to crack down on local crime and "clear" the city of homelessness.

title.children: Trump activates National Guard in Washington, takes over local police

image.altText: An illustration of a young boy staring at a computer. He is surrounded by text bubbles.

props.synopsis: An investigation by triple j hack uncovers allegations of young people in Australia being sexually harassed and even encouraged to take their own life by AI chatbots.

title.children: Young Australian hospitalised after ChatGPT use

image.altText: The Star, Brisbane 2025-01-09 10:01:00

props.synopsis: The group has signed an on-again, off-again deal with its Hong Kong-based partners for the riverside venue in the Queensland capital, bringing it back from the brink of financial calamity.

title.children: Star offloads Brisbane's Queen's Wharf in takeover deal

image.altText: An image of the new Spirit of Tasmania IV in the ocean.

props.synopsis: The 212-metre-long ship has arrived in Australian waters after a six-week voyage from Europe — but it will still be more than a week before it is expected to reach Hobart.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV arrives in Australia after voyage from Scotland

image.altText: Geoff Pearson stands in a paddock with cattle behind him

props.synopsis: A cattle farmer says he's been unable to stock one of his paddocks for three years because hunters keep cutting fences which let his livestock out.

title.children: 'Endless' trespassers cost farmers thousands and endanger life

image.altText: Bright white bleached coral underwater.

props.synopsis: In Western Australia, the damage to coral reefs including the World Heritage-listed Ningaloo has eclipsed any previous bleaching events.

title.children: From 'hope spot' to 'skeletons': Ningaloo's 'catastrophic' event

image.altText: A woman in a suit looks down the barrel of the camera.

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old woman is speaking out years after she was allegedly sexually harassed by her boss at a Mexican restaurant, after the Federal Court this month ordered he pay her a record $305,000.

title.children: Record sexual harassment payout after boss allegedly shows porn, sex toys to worker

image.altText: Ethan Guo sits in the cockpit of a plane.

props.synopsis: Ethan Guo made headlines when he set off in an attempt to become the youngest person to fly solo to all seven continents, but authorities say he landed in Chilean territory without permission.

title.children: US influencer stranded at military base in Antarctica after landing without permission

image.altText: Collage of Good Things 2025 acts against cloudy blue sky: Weezer, Garbage, Tool

props.synopsis: Good Things brings another bumper line-up of alt-rock, metal, punk, and more to the east coast this December, including Wheezer, Garbage, Tool and more.

title.children: One of Australia's biggest and loudest festivals is back

image.altText: Brahman cattle in field.

props.synopsis: A gutted north-west Queensland grazier warns others to vaccinate against blackleg, after nearly 40 of his cattle die of the deadly soil-borne disease.

title.children: Cause of cattle death shocks north Queensland grazier

image.altText: A police officer with their head and face covered holds a gun beside a plain clothes officer outside a house with police tape.

props.synopsis: Heavily armed police found the bodies of a man and woman inside a house that was covered in graffiti in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man arrested at railway station after two found dead in Mount Waverley

image.altText: Bottles of wine on a store shelf.

props.synopsis: People's Alcohol Action Coalition are calling on the two major liquor outlets to sign up to the Alice Springs Liquor Accord's voluntary $1.30 per standard drink alcohol measure six months after the Northern Territory government scrapped the controversial legislation.

title.children: Liquorland, BWS 'dragging feet' on minimum alcohol price, action group says

image.altText: Mima McKim-Hill

props.synopsis: Mima McKim-Hill was murdered in Central Queensland in 1967. Over half a century later, her suspected killer has never faced justice.

title.children: Mima McKim-Hill died in 1967. Her suspected killer never faced justice

image.altText: A man with short dark hair wearing black sunglasses and a black top holds a red AFL football on a film set.

props.synopsis: The international hip-hop artist has been announced as the pre-game entertainment for the 2025 AFL grand final.

title.children: Snoop Dogg to entertain MCG crowd at the AFL grand final

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks to Vladimir Putin standing next to him.

props.synopsis: This week marks the first time Russian President Vladimir Putin has set foot on American soil in almost a decade — but the place he's meeting Donald Trump once belonged to Russia.

title.children: Here's why Trump and Putin picked Alaska for their first meeting in years

image.altText: Colombia Politics Shooting

props.synopsis: Miguel Uribe, a member of a prominent political family and a right-wing opposition senator, was shot in the head at a campaign rally two months ago.

title.children: Colombian presidential hopeful Uribe dies two months after rally shooting

image.altText: Underwater shot of researchers holding dugong.

props.synopsis: The world's largest health study of dugongs in Moreton Bay provides critical clues for helping conserve the enigmatic marine mammal, especially in other locations where numbers are falling.

title.children: Scientists uncover the secret lives of dugongs in Moreton Bay

image.altText: A woman and man shake hands standing in front of flags smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The Nakamal Agreement will cover infrastructure, climate change resilience and economic development, but details on travel and visa arrangements between the two countries remain under wraps.

title.children: Australia close to signing 'ambitious' pact with Vanuatu worth $500m

image.altText: Donnell Wallam of Australia warms up in a track suit, shooting the netball

props.synopsis: Diamonds shooter Donnell Wallam is set to return to the Super Netball competition, signing with the Sunshine Coast Lightning for the 2026 season.

title.children: Diamonds shooter returns to Super Netball after signing with Lightning

image.altText: Two large boats collide near a third vessel which they are chasing on open ocean

props.synopsis: Video shows the moment a Chinese vessel hits the front of the other while on the open sea.

title.children: Fate of Chinese crew unknown after dramatic collision in South China Sea

image.altText: Ben Stokes and Pat Cummins hold a trophy together

props.synopsis: Two decades after playing one of the best Test series ever, Australia and England's equally flawed sides mean the 2005 epic could well be toppled this summer.

title.children: Australia and England's conspicuous flaws set the table for epic Ashes

image.altText: A mid shot of Dockers captain Nat Fyfe handballing a football wearing his white Fremantle jersey.

props.synopsis: As Nat Fyfe announces his retirement, Tom Wildie examines whether the Fremantle Dockers champion gets a spot on the Mount Rushmore of AFL-era players from WA.

title.children: Where Nat Fyfe ranks among WA's AFL greats
